masterclass_speakers.question: What was the name of the Alexis Robert event?
masterclass_speakers.answer: The Alexis Robert event was a masterclass session titled 'Session with Alexis Robert from KIMA Ventures'. Alexis Robert is a General Partner at KIMA Ventures, the most active early-stage VC in France. KIMA invests in over 100 startups per year with tickets of 100-150k EUR. This was described as a must-not-miss session covering insights on what makes a great early stage founder. It took place at 2 PM at the Junior Stage in the Share Zone during Week 2.

masterclass_speakers.question: Who was Emmanuel Straschnov and what did he speak about?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Emmanuel Straschnov is the founder of Bubble, a no-code platform. He delivered a masterclass titled 'Masterclass - Bubble Emmanuel Straschnov' during Week 3 of the program on June 26, 2025. The session covered building and shipping products quickly using no-code tools.

masterclass_speakers.question: What was Salomon Aiach's masterclass about?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Salomon Aiach delivered a masterclass titled 'What it means to be VC backable' during Week 3 on June 23, 2025. The session took place at Singular's office at 38 Rue des Jeuneurs, 75002 Paris. It covered the criteria and characteristics that make startups attractive to venture capital investors.

masterclass_speakers.question: Who spoke about finding the right co-founder?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Guillaume Breton delivered the 'Masterclass Finding the right cofounder' during Week 2. The session covered strategies and best practices for identifying and partnering with the right co-founder for your startup.

masterclass_speakers.question: What was Bruno's masterclass about?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Bruno Aziza delivered a masterclass titled 'Breaking into the Silicon Valley' during Week 9 on August 5, 2025. Bruno has experience scaling startups to IPO and leading at Google, Microsoft, Oracle & IBM. The session unpacked what it really takes to win in the US vs. Europe. It took place in the Hogwarts Express Room.

masterclass_speakers.question: Who spoke about AWS for new founders?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Bakr Annnour from AWS delivered the 'AWS for new Founders' session during Week 5 on July 11, 2025. The session was very positive and hands-on, with a 15-minute intro followed by Q&A. Bakr was able to answer both technical and non-technical questions in detail and was very charismatic. The session took place in the AWS room in the Share Zone.

masterclass_speakers.question: Was there a masterclass about sales and GTM?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Yes, there was a 'Masterclass sales & GTM' (Go-To-Market) during Week 2 on June 17, 2025 at 2 PM. The session covered sales strategies and go-to-market approaches for early-stage startups.

masterclass_speakers.question: Who delivered the 'Shipping Fast' masterclass?
masterclass_speakers.answer: Stéphane Boghossian delivered the 'Shipping Fast' masterclass during Week 10 on August 12, 2025 at 4 PM in the Bodyboard Room. It was a hands-on session where founders presented their tech stacks and learned rapid product development strategies.

social_events.question: What was the last social event about?
social_events.answer: The most recent documented social event was 'Community Drinks @ La Felicita' during Week 2 on June 19, 2025 at 7 PM at Station F. The event featured community drinks with interesting founders from the Pioneers network and included the announcement of the winner of the Startup Challenge.

social_events.question: Tell me about the group dinner with Yassine and Mimoun
social_events.answer: The 'Group diner 25/06/2025 - Yassine & Mimoun' took place during Week 3 on June 25, 2025 at 7 PM at 24 rue du 4 Septembre, 75002 Paris. The dinner featured Yassine Tahi (cofounder of Kinetix) and Mimoun El Alami (cofounder of Stairling and Hook alumni), who shared their entrepreneurial journeys and insights. Pioneers provided food including pizzas.

social_events.question: Were there any board game nights?
social_events.answer: Yes, there was a 'Board Game Night w Artur' during Week 4 on July 2, 2025 at 7 PM. Artur Vianna from the cohort hosted the board game night, described as 'Round 2', indicating there were multiple board game nights throughout the program.

social_events.question: What was the Lunch Roulette event?
social_events.answer: The 'Lunch Roulette 1' took place during Week 2 on June 16, 2025. Founders were randomly assigned to groups of 4 (with some groups of 3) to have lunch together. This was a social activity designed to help cohort members get to know each other better.

program_milestones.question: When was Selection Day and what was the format?
program_milestones.answer: Selection Day took place on Wednesday, July 23, 2025 (announced during Week 7) at 4 PM. The format was: each team pitched in front of the investment committee for 3 minutes + 5 minutes Q&A. The pitch should cover problem, solution, market, traction (or strong signals), team, and roadmap. Selection criteria included: (1) Team & Idea - locked team and fixed problem space, (2) Progress made - clear user feedback, signs of traction or market interest, (3) Ambition & vision - alignment with Pioneers' ambition, (4) MOAT - understanding of differentiating factors.

program_milestones.question: When were Selection Day results announced?
program_milestones.answer: Selection Day results were announced on July 31, 2025 during Week 8 at 2 PM. The announcement included which teams were moving forward to the Sprint Phase. Office hours were held the same day from 11:00-13:00 for teams to get feedback, followed by community drinks in the evening to celebrate the past weeks together.

program_milestones.question: What is Pre-IC and when did it happen?
program_milestones.answer: Pre-IC (Pre-Investment Committee) took place on Monday, September 8, 2025 at 10:00 AM during Week 13. It was held in the Boardroom B Corp in the Share Zone. The format was 5 minutes pitch + 7 minutes Q&A per team. Teams pitched one by one, and it was fully in-person. Pre-IC was the final milestone before the Investment Committee, where teams were evaluated on execution, team dynamics, and market potential.

program_milestones.question: When was the Investment Committee (IC)?
program_milestones.answer: The Investment Committee (IC) was announced for September 12, 2025 during Week 14. Teams had to submit their pitch decks by 3 PM the day before (September 11). The IC was the culmination of the sprint phase where selected teams pitched to secure Pioneers investment of 100K EUR.

program_milestones.question: When was the Pre-IC decision announcement?
program_milestones.answer: The Pre-IC decision announcement happened on September 9, 2025 during Week 14. The teams selected for IC were: Umamy, Mirmi, JooobAI, AvaHome, FitBot, and GovIntel. Selection criteria (in order of importance) were: (1) Execution - GTM traction and product progress, (2) Team - background, cohesion, and founder-product fit, (3) Market - size and potential. Teams not moving forward were offered feedback sessions and could stay at Station F until end of November (paying €259 + VAT/month/per seat).

group_exercises_challenges.question: What was the 'Worst Startup Ever' exercise?
group_exercises_challenges.answer: The 'Group Exercise 1 - Worst startup' took place during Week 1 on June 11, 2025 at 2:00 PM in the Creativity Room. Teams of 3-4 people had to create and pitch the most ridiculously bad startup idea possible - one that was incredibly niche, technically/ethically flawed, or completely unscalable. Teams prepared a 3-4 minute pitch covering name & tagline, problem, solution, business model, target market with market size, GTM strategy, optional fundraising, and team. After all pitches, everyone voted for: Worst Startup Idea, Most Convincing Pitch for a Bad Idea, and Best Team Name.

group_exercises_challenges.question: Tell me about the Startup Challenge
group_exercises_challenges.answer: The 'Group work 2 - Startup Challenge' took place during Week 2 on June 18, 2025. Teams of 3-4 had to complete as many startup-related tasks as possible to earn points. Challenges included: User Interviews (100 points each), 1-Minute Video Elevator Pitch (40 points), Logo (5 points), 6-Slide Pitch Presentation (30 points), Landing Page (30 points), Figma Product Design (50 points), User Onboarding Flow (50 points), LinkedIn Page (15 points), 10 ways to promote product for free (30 points), Email Subscribers (5 points each), Build community of 50 people for B2C (200 points), Sign LOI with someone for B2B (150 points). The challenge ran from 10:20 AM to 12:10 PM. The winning team received a 100 EUR Amazon gift card per member. Important notes: Freelancers and prosumers don't count as B2B customers - B2B customers must pay from company expenses and have at least 1 FTE. LOIs must have digital or physical signature (emails not accepted).

group_exercises_challenges.question: What was the 'Build your Distribution Machine' challenge?
group_exercises_challenges.answer: The 'Mini Challenge 2' titled 'Build your Distribution Machine' took place during Week 2 on June 17, 2025 at 2:00 PM. Teams of 4 had 1.5 hours to: (1) Pick an industry and build a value prop (landing page with signup, newsletter, advertisement, or social post), (2) Drive first traffic and get 5+ signups using channels like Product Hunt Ship, Reddit, Facebook groups, IndieHackers, or in-person signups. Teams submitted by 5:45 PM in #submissions channel with: project name, team members, 1-liner, website link, tool used (Webflow, Lovable, Wordpress), channels used, users reached, and number of sign-ups. At 5:45 PM there was a group recap and debrief.

friday_pitches.question: How did Friday pitches work?
friday_pitches.answer: Friday pitches were weekly presentations where teams pitched their startups to the cohort and Pioneers team, typically at 3-5 PM on Fridays. Only founders in teams participated. The format evolved throughout the program: early pitches (Week 2) were 3 minutes max for status updates covering team formation, idea snapshot (problem, solution, market, core hypothesis), and plans. Later pitches (Week 5+) were 5 minutes max with 2 minutes for project intro and 3 minutes for progress updates. Teams had to submit decks beforehand, and pitches took place in-person in rooms like the Share Zone or Bodyboard Room.

friday_pitches.question: Who joined Friday pitches as special guests?
friday_pitches.answer: Dominika Wilinska, former Investment Associate at Antler and advisor to Pioneers, joined Friday pitches on July 18, 2025 during Week 6. Salomon Aiach (Singular) joined Friday pitches for the first time on August 30, 2025 during Week 12, alongside Hugo and Maxime, marking the first time 3 IC decision-makers were present together.

friday_pitches.question: When was the first Pitch Day?
friday_pitches.answer: The first Pitch Day was on June 20, 2025 during Week 2 at 5:00 PM. For this first session, teams gave a status report of the first two weeks. Solo founders briefly reminded who they were, whether they matched with someone, if they had an idea, learnings, and next week plans. Teams (joint pitch) covered: idea snapshot (problem & solution, market size/trends/opportunities, core hypothesis + plan), and team presentation. No deck was required (optional). Presentation was 3 minutes max.

theme_sessions.question: What were theme-based events?
theme_sessions.answer: Theme-based events took place on Wednesdays from 2:00-3:30/4:00 PM. The first session during Week 4 on July 2, 2025 had three 25-30 minute slots covering different topics: Session 1 with Tomas (cohort member) on 'Intro to AI' - covering different areas of AI and latest developments; Session 2 with Nicholas (cohort member) on 'Intro to Robotics & Humanoids' - market overview, learnings, and potential opportunities; Session 3 with Julie (cohort member) on 'Product Management' - sharing how product development works from startups to scaleups, covering user discovery, testing, prioritizing features, scaling and pivoting.

theme_sessions.question: What was the weekly theme for Week 4?
theme_sessions.answer: The weekly theme for Week 4 (starting June 30, 2025) was 'Distribution'. The announcement emphasized: 'AI made building easy, now the hard part is reach. If you can't get your product in front of the right people, it doesn't matter how good it is. So either your product solves such a deep pain that cold outreach converts unusually well, or you'll need to think way outside the box to crack your distribution.'

office_hours_support.question: How did office hours work during the program?
office_hours_support.answer: Office hours evolved throughout the program. During the initial weeks (Weeks 1-4), there were regular 'Team Office Hours' where founders could get feedback. During the Sprint Phase (Weeks 9-11), office hours were structured as 15-minute slots per team, running Monday-Wednesday. After August 21 (Week 11), fixed office hours stopped but founders could still reach out to Niklas or Maxime anytime to schedule feedback sessions. After Selection Day, teams not selected were offered 1-on-1 feedback sessions.

office_hours_support.question: Were there office hours for external founders?
office_hours_support.answer: Yes, 'Summer Office Hours (for externals w email + calendly)' were held during Week 9 on August 6-7, 2025. These were open to external founders (not in the cohort) who could book sessions via email and Calendly.

office_hours_support.question: What was the LinkedIn Support channel?
office_hours_support.answer: The LinkedIn Support channel (#linkedin-support) was announced during Week 6 on July 17, 2025. It was created for cohort members to support each other's LinkedIn posts and boost visibility for what they're building. Founders could share their posts and help amplify each other's reach.

program_logistics.question: When was the program kick-off?
program_logistics.answer: The official Pioneers SU2025 Kick-off was on Wednesday, June 11, 2025 at 9:15 AM sharp at Station F (main entrance reception). Founders needed to bring their ID to get onboarded. Before kick-off, founders were asked to: add the Pioneers Calendar, say hi on Slack in #su25-introduce-yourself, and join the WhatsApp group.

program_logistics.question: What was Basecamp Day?
program_logistics.answer: Basecamp Day was on Thursday, June 13, 2025 during Week 1. It was described as 'the key date to set you up for the program' and was made mandatory for everyone who was in Paris. It was specifically scheduled to accommodate those planning to attend VivaTech.

program_logistics.question: What attendance policies were there?
program_logistics.answer: An attendance message was sent on June 17, 2025 during Week 2, stating that participation is a core part of the Pioneers experience for both exercises and masterclasses. If founders couldn't attend, they had to message Niklas ideally 12 hours before the session starts. If Pioneers didn't hear from them, they assumed the founder would attend. This rule applied to all future exercises/masterclass sessions.

program_logistics.question: When did weekly updates need to be submitted?
program_logistics.answer: Weekly updates had to be submitted every Monday before day-end via an Airtable form. A reminder was sent during Week 7 on July 23, 2025, emphasizing that weekly updates were essential for tracking progress and informing the investment committee. The form link was shared in Slack.

program_logistics.question: What was the 'Building with Pioneers' initiative?
program_logistics.answer: The 'Building with Pioneers' initiative was rolled out during Week 9 on August 5, 2025. Individual LinkedIn post templates were distributed to founders on Figma to help them present their startup journey to their network. The templates were designed to help unlock opportunities like clients, investors, and advisors. The template included: announcement of joining Pioneers, startup name and vision, cofounder mention, problem being solved, unique insight, and call-to-action for target talent, customers, or investors.

special_announcements.question: What Station F perks were available?
special_announcements.answer: Founders got 30% off at La Felicita (Station F's food hall) with the code STATIONFEFE30. The code was valid from Monday to Friday between 8 AM and 3 PM. Additionally, founders could request guest invite codes to spend a day at Station F before the program officially started (weekdays only, Share Zone access).

special_announcements.question: Was there a feedback form during the program?
special_announcements.answer: Yes, a feedback form was sent during Week 2 on June 19, 2025. As the very first Pioneers batch, founder input was considered incredibly valuable. The anonymous form asked for honest thoughts on the past days - events, workshops, and the program overall, including what worked, what didn't, and what could be improved.

special_announcements.question: What happened to teams not selected after Selection Day?
special_announcements.answer: Teams not selected after Selection Day (announced July 31, 2025) received 1-on-1 feedback during office hours on August 1. They could stay at Station F until the end of November but would need to cover the cost of their seat (€259 + VAT/month/per seat). They remained part of the Pioneers alumni community, would be invited to future events and workshops, and would be fast-tracked for consideration for future cohorts. They were outboarded on Tuesday August 6 but could always come back for meetings.

metadata.intended_use: Answer specific questions about 2025 program sessions, events, speakers, and milestones
metadata.answer_style: Detailed, fact-based responses with specific dates, locations, speakers, and event details from actual session records
